title: Kindred JUST Became Viable
body:
And now you are halfing wolves attack speed, and giving her ult 20 seconds more cd, most people actually agreed when i asked that she is in an ALRIGHT spot right now, but no. The moment Kindred becomes any type of viable, they nerf her to the ground take a look

Kindred W: Wolf attack speed scaling decreased from 50% to 25%

Kindred R: +20 seconds CD for each rank 

Like this is bs, she literally finally became playable again for 2 goddamn patches and then they nerf her to the ground. Make up your mind rito, u want kindred to be a champion or not?

She is more than playable; she's like top 2 jg right now and has more power than required to be viable. She's supposed to win through skill - kinda like lee sin. But right now she can win through sheer force/stats no skill required. If you play a melee top and she ganks you away from your tower, you better have a good escape or you're basically guaranteed dead where you'd have a chance against other junglers. The problem with people is, they can't be happy with something just being viable and taking some skill to win with. They just want broken stuff where they can braindead win with. Well I picked quinn top vs a melee, gg I win. I picked talon mid vs a teemo, gg I win. Or something like that. Rather than... I used my champ's kit better than you did, I win. Or I played the macro game better and outplayed you in teamfight... I win.

Champs are supposed to win off skill moreso than pure out-statting someone. Hence why everyone gets upset with mundo recently. And kindred was overbuffed to much the same situation - pure stupid out-statting; no skill required.

I can definitely argue about the skill part, she does have a lot of skill expression, her R + E combo and getting it off and escaping properlyby auto cancelling and wall hopping, early game kiting, etc, the wolf mechanics will practically mean _NOTHING_ now because of how bad wolf will be. pretty much any champ ahead takes no skill, any adc, graves 2 shotting you, rengar R + Q one shot, any champ that is ahead will take not that much skill, but i gaurantee you no new player level 40 down will know how to play kindred, that is saying something.

Kindred is basically skill intensive as she has the strangest jungling route, a lot of counterplay, strange mechanics, etc.
no hate to you tho, im just showing you that shes in a perfectly balanced spot and riot is removing her from the game yet again

I would disagree with her being in a "perfectly balanced spot". We buffed her a few patches in a row - the bugfix turned out to be a lot bigger of a buff than we expected so we're handling that accordingly. The R line nerf is directed more towards her pro play presence.

I'm incredibly doubtful that the changelist on PBE will make her unplayable, only move her down from the top.

Then why nerf the ultimate if the ultimate isn't what makes kindred overpowered?

It's clearly the recent change that gave Kindred healing that pushed them over the edge, so why make changes to their ultimate to have a 3-minute cooldown rank 1? Doesn't make sense.

The R line has two factors involved; one, the R is more powerful in coordinated environments and hits her pro play presence. The other reason is because, it's a nerf to Kindred without heavily impacting the character's satisfaction towards the average player while also theoretically positively impacting all players in the game. Kindred R as a spell is a cool spell - When used frequently, however, it's something I'd more heavily lean into saying is less "fun" for all parties involved.

The problem is that their entire kit is based around stat-checking their opponents. The only element of skill is the "zone" placement, which _**can**_ be tactical but it really doesn't matter either way until like MLG level, and that's it.

This is to say, her stat-checking as you are referring to, is there since their inception and not something that just happened to have occurred recently.

No, her entire kit is around using mobility to stay out of your range and deal damage. And to negate any engage/burst you manage to get off that would otherwise kill her or one of her teammates via her ult. She plays the "you can't catch me" game like vayne does - using mobility and disengage/kite to make up for being shorter ranged. If she were meant to be pure stat check, then she'd stand still while dueling a melee opponent and let them walk right up to her and fight back while she turreted them down. But that's not how she plays.

> [{quoted}](name=woodvsmurph,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=G6QG1YYW,comment-id=000100020000,timestamp=2018-07-26T07:55:13.265+0000)
>
> No, her entire kit is around using mobility to stay out of your range and deal damage. And to negate any engage/burst you manage to get off that would otherwise kill her or one of her teammates via her ult. She plays the "you can't catch me" game like vayne does - using mobility and disengage/kite to make up for being shorter ranged. If she were meant to be pure stat check, then she'd stand still while dueling a melee opponent and let them walk right up to her and fight back while she turreted them down. But that's not how she plays.

As I was saying, while they certainly can play with kites and all, but their kit doesn't really require that fundamentally given outside of their Q, the rest of their kit including passive directly encourages stat-checking, with arguably the largest culprit being ulti. Kindred's kit basically is just about setting up a choke point and overwhelm the opponents with superior stats within it, or chasing the opponent down with hops and destroy them with their AA boosted from farming marks and whatnot.

If they have any gameplay problem, it's at the design in my eyes, rather than a balance problem.

You have dashes and a giant aoe slow that exists for a decent duration. Combined with redbuff slow that is a ton of cc and mobility advantage vs almost anyone early on. This is why she's so damn scary and effective in early fights. I'm not talking anything about how she scales into the game; which isn't too shabby. I'm looking primarily at her early ability to duel, counter-jungle, and gank lanes. She's insanely strong at these.... probably a bit too good at punishing melee toplaners especially due to the tandem slow of redbuff and wolf. Combined with her low cd hop and her ability to STAY at range while doing all her damage makes it far easier to gank with her than many other junglers while removing real counterplay that others such as elise or lee offer. Sure they can match her initial dmg and/or cc and mobility, but then they either have to commit and enter melee range and be punishable or they have to back off and be happy with the dmg and cc they got off and leave. Kindred is non-commital continued harass/dps... much like a jungler version of zoe. Other champs also tend to pay for this a bit more than kindred by not scaling as well as she does.

So either she needs to be less punishing early to play against or she needs to scale less well into the game. Riot kinda took a swing at both. Not a fatal one... not by a long shot. She should now be in a spot where GOOD kindred players can still use her KIT and win both early and later in the game, but bad kindred players who use her kit poorly or not at all FAIL rather than win despite the other person(s) playing better than them. In essence, it's no different than the changes to ahri which reduced her damage if she fails to land charm, but buffed it if she does land it. They are making it so GOOD players win because they play the champ well and UNSKILLED players can't win simply by pure stat-check. You don't have to like it... but you can't honestly say it's unfair or going to make her unplayable.
none of that is an excuse to completely gut her while pretty much every other champ would get a tiny slap on the wrist, completely halving a ability is 100% no the way to go
